segment.source: OEM and enterprise customers can utilize a set of scripts and tools to deliver app updates for Windows 10 IoT Core (IoT Core) devices.
segment.target: OEM and enterprise customers can utilize a set of scripts and tools to deliver app updates for Windows 10 IoT Core (IoT Core) devices.

segment.source: Update apps on your IoT Core devices
segment.target: Update apps on your IoT Core devices

segment.source: Update apps on your IoT Core devices
segment.target: Update apps on your IoT Core devices

segment.source: OEMs and enterprise customers can deliver app updates to Windows 10 IoT Core (IoT Core) devices by running ApplyUpdate.exe from the device, or by submitting updates to the Windows Store.
segment.target: OEMs and enterprise customers can deliver app updates to Windows 10 IoT Core (IoT Core) devices by running ApplyUpdate.exe from the device, or by submitting updates to the Windows Store.

segment.source: Prerequisites
segment.target: Prerequisites

segment.source: Create an app and add it to your device, as shown in Lab 1b: Add an app to your image.
segment.target: Create an app and add it to your device, as shown in Lab 1b: Add an app to your image.

segment.source: For store updates, sign and submit the app package to the Windows Store.
segment.target: For store updates, sign and submit the app package to the Windows Store.

segment.source: Create an update package
segment.target: Create an update package

segment.source: Create a new version of your app, and package it into a .cab file using the same method in Lab 1b: Add an app to your image.
segment.target: Create a new version of your app, and package it into a .cab file using the same method in Lab 1b: Add an app to your image.

segment.source: It's OK to reuse the existing package names and even write over the old folder names and locations (though we recommend backing up your files first, in case you'd like to revert the change later.)
segment.target: It's OK to reuse the existing package names and even write over the old folder names and locations (though we recommend backing up your files first, in case you'd like to revert the change later.)

segment.source: Use a higher version number each time.
segment.target: Use a higher version number each time.

segment.source: If you're adding the image to a retail build or to the Windows Store, sign the app package.
segment.target: If you're adding the image to a retail build or to the Windows Store, sign the app package.

segment.source: Apply update directly to the device
segment.target: Apply update directly to the device

segment.source: Log into the device and run ApplyUpdate.exe to trigger the update process.
segment.target: Log into the device and run ApplyUpdate.exe to trigger the update process.

segment.source: Copy the .cab file to the device.
segment.target: Copy the .cab file to the device.

segment.source: You can do this using an FTP tool such as WinSCP, or by copying the file directly to the device's drive (such as a micro SD card.)
segment.target: You can do this using an FTP tool such as WinSCP, or by copying the file directly to the device's drive (such as a micro SD card.)

segment.source: On your technician PC, connect to your device using an SSH client, such as PuTTY.
segment.target: On your technician PC, connect to your device using an SSH client, such as PuTTY.

segment.source: For example, use the IP address and port 22 to connect to the device, then log in using the Administrator account and password.
segment.target: For example, use the IP address and port 22 to connect to the device, then log in using the Administrator account and password.

segment.source: (To learn more, see Using SSH to connect and configure a device running Windows IoT Core.)
segment.target: (To learn more, see Using SSH to connect and configure a device running Windows IoT Core.)

segment.source: From the device command line, stage the update.
segment.target: From the device command line, stage the update.

segment.source: You can repeat this step to stage multiple updates.
segment.target: You can repeat this step to stage multiple updates.

segment.source: Commit the changes.
segment.target: Commit the changes.

segment.source: This command also triggers the Windows Update process, installing any applicable updates.
segment.target: This command also triggers the Windows Update process, installing any applicable updates.

segment.source: (To reject all updates, use: instead.)
segment.target: (To reject all updates, use: instead.)

segment.source: Troubleshooting:
segment.target: Troubleshooting:

segment.source: Error: A certificate chain could not be built to a trusted root authority.
segment.target: Error: A certificate chain could not be built to a trusted root authority.

segment.source: Signature verification failed.
segment.target: Signature verification failed.

segment.source: Possible cause: Adding test signed images to a retail image.
segment.target: Possible cause: Adding test signed images to a retail image.

segment.source: Sign the image and try again.
segment.target: Sign the image and try again.

segment.source: Possible cause: Package version incorrect.
segment.target: Possible cause: Package version incorrect.

segment.source: Make sure the new version number is higher than the old version and try again.
segment.target: Make sure the new version number is higher than the old version and try again.

segment.source: Error: Could not start update (0x8024A10F) Possible cause: Windows Update is in progress.
segment.target: Error: Could not start update (0x8024A10F) Possible cause: Windows Update is in progress.

segment.source: Try again after the current Windows Update is completed.
segment.target: Try again after the current Windows Update is completed.

segment.source: Apply update from the Windows Store
segment.target: Apply update from the Windows Store

segment.source: Submit your updated signed package to the Windows Store.
segment.target: Submit your updated signed package to the Windows Store.

segment.source: When your devices are connected to the internet, they'll periodically check for updates from the Windows Store, and install the updates automatically.
segment.target: When your devices are connected to the internet, they'll periodically check for updates from the Windows Store, and install the updates automatically.
